summary: This is an email chain from August 5, 2019, discussing coordination between the Department of Justice (ODAG/DAG's office) and the FBI regarding victim notification for the Jeffrey Epstein case. The correspondence focuses on ensuring the victim notification list is comprehensive, matches the FBI's VNS system, and that all identified victims are contacted about available services.

events.title: Coordination on Epstein Victim Notification
events.description: Email correspondence between DOJ officials and the FBI regarding the victim notification list for the Jeffrey Epstein case, focusing on verifying the list's completeness and coordinating outreach to victims.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 5, 2019, concerning victim notification in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

The Deputy Attorney General's (DAG's) office is coordinating with the FBI to ensure all identified victims, including those from the original Southern District of Florida (SDFL) case, are on the victim notification list.
The goal is to have a victim specialist (either from the DOJ or FBI) contact every identified victim to inform them of potential victim services.
The correspondence references an attached list of 32 individuals from document EFTA00152155 as part of the victim identification effort.
The emails discuss comparing the DOJ's notification list with the FBI's Victim Notification System (VNS) to ensure consistency and completeness.
